Property.Name: executionWatchdogTimeout
Property.Description: A Lua exception is raised when any thread runs uninterrupted for longer than this time (in ms).

Property.Name: autoGCIdleTimeout
Property.Description: The number of seconds the system must be idle before an automatic garbage collection occurs.

Property.Name: autoGCMemThreshold
Property.Description: Memory use threshold above which auto-GC will activate.

Property.Name: powerSave
Property.Description: Controls terminal power saving feature.

Property.Name: timeSyncRetry
Property.Description: The time interval (in minutes) between attempts at getting a position fix to set the time on startup.

Property.Name: ledControl
Property.Description: Determines whether the terminal or a user service has control of the LED operation

Property.Name: ledStatusTimeout
Property.Description: Specifies how many minutes the terminal LED status indicator will blink when in ‘Terminal’ LED Control. (0 means indefinitely)

Property.Name: systemTime
Property.Description: Current time-of-day expressed as seconds since EPOCH, or zero if not set.

Property.Name: terminalUptime
Property.Description: The number of seconds the terminal has been in continuous operation.

Property.Name: LSFUptime
Property.Description: The number of seconds since the Lua Services Framework started.

Property.Name: timeSyncInterval
Property.Description: The time interval (in minutes) between attempts at synchronization with the modem clock, after the time has become available.

Property.Name: timeSyncThreshold
Property.Description: If the terminal clock differs from the modem clock by more than this number of seconds (or more), adjust it.

Property.Name: powerLedMode
Property.Description: Controls whether the power LED mode (IDP-782 only).

Message.Name: getTerminalInfo
Message.Description: Request terminal information. A terminalInfo message is generated in response.

Message.Name: getTerminalStatus
Message.Description: Request terminal status. A terminalStatus message is generated in response.

Message.Name: getServiceList
Message.Description: Request a list of all services. A serviceList message is generated in response.

Message.Name: getServiceInfo
Message.Description: Request information for one or more services. A serviceInfo message is generated in response.

Message.Name: restartService
Message.Description: Request to restart a service.

Message.Name: resetTerminal
Message.Description: Request to restart the terminal. If the resetAll field is True, also resets all hardware.

Field.Name: resetAll
Field.Description: If true, all hardware is reset in addition to the terminal.

Message.Name: getTerminalMetrics
Message.Description: Request current terminal metrics. Currently, no message is generated in response, since no metrics have been defined.

Message.Name: getProperties
Message.Description: Request the value of one or more properties. A propertyValues message is generated in response.

Field.Name: list
Field.Description: If not provided, or size is 0, get properties from all services.

Field.Name: pinList
Field.Description: If size is 0, get all properties from that service.

Message.Name: setProperties
Message.Description: Sets the value of one or more properties.

Message.Name: resetProperties
Message.Description: Resets one or more properties to their default values.

Field.Name: list
Field.Description: If not provided, or size is 0, reset properties for all services.

Field.Name: pinList
Field.Description: If size is 0, reset all properties for that service.

Message.Name: saveProperties
Message.Description: Saves one or more property values to non-volatile storage.

Field.Name: list
Field.Description: If not provided, or size is 0, save properties for all services.

Field.Name: pinList
Field.Description: If size is 0, save all properties for that service.

Message.Name: revertProperties
Message.Description: Reverts one or more property values from non-volatile storage.

Field.Name: list
Field.Description: If not provided, or size is 0, revert properties for all services.

Field.Name: pinList
Field.Description: If size is 0, revert all properties for that service.

Message.Name: restartFramework
Message.Description: Restarts the Lua Framework.

Message.Name: setPassword
Message.Description: Sets a new password value

Field.Name: old
Field.Description: The current password value.

Field.Name: new
Field.Description: The new password value. Empty string to remove the password.

Message.Name: disableService
Message.Description: Disables, or re-enables, a service.

Field.Name: sin
Field.Description: The Service Identification Number for the service to disable/re-enable.

Field.Name: disable
Field.Description: Disable the service if True, or re-enable it otherwise.

Message.Name: setEnabledServices
Message.Description: Sets the list of enabled services.

Field.Name: sinList
Field.Description: Lists all services that are to be enabled (each data byte represents one SIN).

Message.Name: setFactoryPassword
Message.Description: Sets a new factory password value.

Field.Name: old
Field.Description: The current password value.

Field.Name: new
Field.Description: The new password value.

Message.Name: terminalInfo
Message.Description: Static terminal information.

Field.Name: hardwareVariant
Field.Description: This field indicates the terminal type.

Field.Name: hardwareRevision
Field.Description: The hardware revision number.

Field.Name: hardwareFeatureMask
Field.Description: Bit mask indicating hardware features

Field.Name: hardwareManufacturingID
Field.Description: Manufacturing ID of the terminal motherboard.

Field.Name: bootLoaderMajor
Field.Description: The major version number of the installed boot loader.

Field.Name: bootLoaderMinor
Field.Description: The minor version number of the installed boot loader.

Field.Name: bootLoaderPatch
Field.Description: The patch level number of the installed boot loader.

Field.Name: bootLoaderDescription
Field.Description: Build description

Field.Name: firmwareMajor
Field.Description: The major version number of the installed base firmware.

Field.Name: firmwareMinor
Field.Description: The minor version number of the installed base firmware.

Field.Name: firmwarePatch
Field.Description: The patch level number of the installed base firmware.

Field.Name: firmwareDescription
Field.Description: Build description

Field.Name: LSFVersion
Field.Description: Lua services framework version string

Field.Name: packageVersion
Field.Description: Version string of the loaded package.

Message.Name: terminalStatus
Message.Description: Dynamic terminal information.

Field.Name: uptime
Field.Description: The number of seconds the terminal has been in continuous operation.

Field.Name: timeOfDay
Field.Description: The current date & time, expressed as number of seconds since the epoch.

Field.Name: hardwareResetReason
Field.Description: The reason from the hardware for the last terminal reset.

Field.Name: softwareResetReason
Field.Description: The cause of the software reset.

Field.Name: softwareResetDescription
Field.Description: Extra information about the software reset cause.

Field.Name: LSFUptime
Field.Description: The number of seconds since the Lua Services Framework started.

Field.Name: powerSaveTime
Field.Description: The number of seconds the terminal has been in power save mode.

Field.Name: LSFIdleTime
Field.Description: The number of seconds the Lua Services Framework has been idle waiting for an event since startup.

Message.Name: serviceList
Message.Description: List of installed terminal services.

Field.Name: sinList
Field.Description: Each byte in the data field represents the SIN of an enabled service.

Field.Name: disabledList
Field.Description: Each byte in the data field represents the SIN of a disabled service.

Message.Name: serviceInfo
Message.Description: Static information for one or more services.

Field.Name: sin
Field.Description: The SIN.

Field.Name: name
Field.Description: The service name, up to 64 characters.

Field.Name: version
Field.Description: Free-form service version, up to 16 characters.

Field.Name: enabled
Field.Description: Whether the service is currently enabled.

Field.Name: running
Field.Description: True if the service is running.

Message.Name: propertyValues
Message.Description: A list of current property values.

Field.Name: list
Field.Description: A list of services.

Field.Name: sin
Field.Description: The SIN.

Field.Name: propList
Field.Description: A list of properties for that service.

Field.Name: pin
Field.Description: The PIN.

Field.Name: value
Field.Description: The property value.

Message.Name: termReset
Message.Description: Indicates a terminal reset. This message is only used for logging purposes.

Message.Name: timeSync
Message.Description: Indicates a time synchronization event. This message is only used for logging purposes.

Field.Name: time
Field.Description: The new date & time, expressed as number of seconds since the epoch.

Message.Name: terminalRegistration
Message.Description: Terminal registration message; automatically sent at system startup.

Field.Name: hardwareVariant
Field.Description: This field indicates the terminal type.

Field.Name: hardwareRevision
Field.Description: The hardware revision number.

Field.Name: hardwareResetReason
Field.Description: The reason from the hardware for the last terminal reset.

Field.Name: firmwareMajor
Field.Description: The major version number of the installed base firmware.

Field.Name: firmwareMinor
Field.Description: The minor version number of the installed base firmware.

Field.Name: firmwarePatch
Field.Description: The patch level number of the installed base firmware.

Field.Name: LSFVersion
Field.Description: Lua services framework version string

Field.Name: softwareResetReason
Field.Description: The cause of the software reset.

Field.Name: sinList
Field.Description: Each byte in the data field is the SIN of an installed service.

Field.Name: packageVersion
Field.Description: Version string of the loaded package.

Message.Name: setPasswordResult
Message.Description: The result from a setPassword message.

Field.Name: success
Field.Description: Whether the operation succeeded or not.

Field.Name: error
Field.Description: A description of the error, if success is false.

Message.Name: disableServiceResult
Message.Description: The result of a disableService request.

Field.Name: sin
Field.Description: The Service Identification Number for the service that was disabled/re-enabled.

Field.Name: disable
Field.Description: Whether an attempt was made to disable or re-enable the service.

Field.Name: success
Field.Description: Whether the attempt was successful or not.

Property.Name: model
Property.Description: Model string from the modem

Property.Name: firmwareRevision
Property.Description: Firmware revision of the modem

Property.Name: mobileID
Property.Description: Mobile serial number identfication

Property.Name: networkID
Property.Description: Unique network identification number

Property.Name: hardwareRevision
Property.Description: Hardware revision of the modem

Property.Name: protocolVersion
Property.Description: The protocol version of the AT interface.

Property.Name: powerMode
Property.Description: The modem's main power operating mode.

Property.Name: wakeUpInterval
Property.Description: The interval between modem wake ups for receiving messages.

Property.Name: forceDoppler
Property.Description: When set to true, this overrides the automatic doppler correction mode.

Property.Name: antennaCut
Property.Description: Indicates an antenna cut problem when true.

Message.Name: getSReg
Message.Description: Retrieves an S-register value.

Field.Name: num
Field.Description: The S-register number.

Message.Name: setSreg
Message.Description: Sets an S-register value

Field.Name: num
Field.Description: The S-register number.

Field.Name: val
Field.Description: The desired S-register value.

Message.Name: getMetrics
Message.Description: Retrieves a metrics block from the modem based on the class and subclass.

Field.Name: class
Field.Description: The class of the desired metrics block.

Field.Name: subclass
Field.Description: The subclass of the desired metrics block.

Message.Name: getSRegResult
Message.Description: The result of a getSReg operation.

Field.Name: num
Field.Description: The S-register number.

Field.Name: val
Field.Description: The S-register value.

Field.Name: success
Field.Description: Indicates success of the get operation.

Message.Name: setSRegResult
Message.Description: The result of a setSReg operation.

Field.Name: num
Field.Description: The S-register number.

Field.Name: success
Field.Description: Indicates success of the set operation.

Message.Name: metricsResult
Message.Description: The requested metrics block.

Field.Name: metrics
Field.Description: Contains all metrics for the given class/subclass.

Field.Name: value
Field.Description: The individual metric value

Property.Name: priority
Property.Description: Default value used as the priority when sending a message.

Property.Name: retry
Property.Description: Specifies whether to perform retries.

Property.Name: lifetime
Property.Description: Specifies the message lifetime, in minutes. After this amount of time has elapsed, unsent messages will be cancelled.

Property.Name: log
Property.Description: Specifies whether all outgoing messages are to be logged.

Property.Name: transport1
Property.Description: This property is reserved for future use.

Property.Name: transport2
Property.Description: This property is reserved for future use.

Property.Name: transport3
Property.Description: This property is reserved for future use.

Property.Name: transport4
Property.Description: This property is reserved for future use.

Property.Name: transport5
Property.Description: This property is reserved for future use.

Property.Name: transport6
Property.Description: This property is reserved for future use.

Property.Name: transport7
Property.Description: This property is reserved for future use.

Property.Name: transport8
Property.Description: This property is reserved for future use.

Property.Name: timeout1
Property.Description: This property is reserved for future use.

Property.Name: timeout2
Property.Description: This property is reserved for future use.

Property.Name: timeout3
Property.Description: This property is reserved for future use.

Property.Name: timeout4
Property.Description: This property is reserved for future use.

Property.Name: timeout5
Property.Description: This property is reserved for future use.

Property.Name: timeout6
Property.Description: This property is reserved for future use.

Property.Name: timeout7
Property.Description: This property is reserved for future use.

Property.Name: timeout8
Property.Description: This property is reserved for future use.

Property.Name: queueCount
Property.Description: The current number of messages in the queue awaiting transmission.

Property.Name: retryInterval
Property.Description: The amount of time to wait between retry attempts.

Property.Name: retryMultiplier
Property.Description: Controls whether each retry after the first increases in duration.

Property.Name: replyOnSameTransport
Property.Description: Specifies whether core services reply to request messages on the same transport.

Property.Name: blockedThreshold
Property.Description: How many minutes must elapse without any messages successfully transmitting before the queue is declared blocked.

Message.Name: getStatus
Message.Description: Request the current status for multiple messages. Note that the terminal has a queue depth of 20 for pending messages, and 5 for completed messages. A msgStatus message is generated in response.

Field.Name: msgList
Field.Description: If not specified, or if the size is 0, return the status of all messages.

Field.Name: refNo
Field.Description: Specifies the reference number of a single message for which the status is requested.

Message.Name: cancel
Message.Description: Cancel a pending message.

Field.Name: refNo
Field.Description: Specifies the reference number of a single message which is to be cancelled.

Message.Name: custom
Message.Description: A custom message to send out. This message in response to a CLI command received from either an interactive user or an external piece of software connected to the RS232.

Field.Name: data
Field.Description: The data to be sent out.

Message.Name: msgStatus
Message.Description: The current status of one or more messages.

Field.Name: msgList
Field.Description: A list of all requested messages.

Field.Name: refNo
Field.Description: The message's reference number.

Field.Name: sin
Field.Description: The message's SIN.

Field.Name: min
Field.Description: The message's MIN.

Field.Name: status
Field.Description: The current message status.

Field.Name: send
Field.Description: A copy of the send flag used for the message.

Field.Name: retry
Field.Description: A copy of the retry flag used for the message.

Field.Name: log
Field.Description: A copy of the log flag used for the message.

Field.Name: lifetime
Field.Description: A copy of the lifetime value used for the message.

Field.Name: age
Field.Description: The current age of the message (how long it's been in the queue), in minutes.

Field.Name: transport
Field.Description: The transport the message is currently sending on, or has been sent on.

Field.Name: attempt
Field.Description: The current attempt at sending the message. Can only be above 1 when the retry flag is true.

Field.Name: statusTime
Field.Description: The time of the last status change.

Message.Name: msgInvalid
Message.Description: Notification that the terminal received a binary message which it cannot parse.

Field.Name: desc
Field.Description: A string describing the problem with the message.

Field.Name: sin
Field.Description: The SIN of the invalid message.

Field.Name: min
Field.Description: The MIN of the invalid message.

Field.Name: payload
Field.Description: The first 16 payload bytes of the invalid message.

Message.Name: msgError
Message.Description: Notification that an error occurred while processing a received message.

Field.Name: desc
Field.Description: A string describing the problem with the message.

Field.Name: sin
Field.Description: The SIN of the message that caused the error.

Field.Name: min
Field.Description: The MIN of the message that caused the error.

Property.Name: dataLogEnabled
Property.Description: Controls whether the data log is enabled or not.

Property.Name: maxDataLogSize
Property.Description: Maximum size of a single data log file (KB).

Property.Name: maxDataLogFiles
Property.Description: Maximum number of data log files.

Property.Name: debugLogEnabled
Property.Description: Controls whether the debug log is enabled or not.

Property.Name: maxDebugLogSize
Property.Description: Maximum size of a single debug log file (KB).

Property.Name: maxDebugLogFiles
Property.Description: Maximum number of debug log files.

Property.Name: debugLogLevelsMask
Property.Description: Controls which debug levels are logged.

Property.Name: uploadDataLogEnabled
Property.Description: Controls whether auto upload of data logs is enabled or disabled.

Property.Name: uploadDebugLogEnabled
Property.Description: Controls whether auto upload of debug logs is enabled or disabled.

Property.Name: uploadTransport1
Property.Description: The first transport to use for auto upload. 0 - Use transport(s) configured in Message service 1 - IDP modem 2 - GPRS modem All other values are reserved.

Property.Name: uploadTimeout1
Property.Description: Specifies the amount of time, in minutes, to wait before giving up transmitting an auto upload message on uploadTransport1 and moving on to uploadTransport2. Not used if uploadTransport1 is 0 or only one upload transport is defined.

Property.Name: uploadTransport2
Property.Description: The second transport to use for auto upload. 0 - None 1 - IDP modem 2 - GPRS modem All other values are reserved.

Property.Name: uploadTimeout2
Property.Description: Specifies the amount of time, in minutes, to wait before giving up transmitting an auto upload message on uploadTransport2. Not used if uploadTransport1 or uploadTransport2 is 0.

Property.Name: uploadRetryInterval
Property.Description: The amount of time to wait between retry attempts for upload messages.

Property.Name: uploadRetryMultiplier
Property.Description: Controls whether each retry after the first increases in duration.

Property.Name: logSuppress2
Property.Description: Controls which level 2 (WARNING) debug logs are not saved to the log file. Each byte is a SIN.

Property.Name: logSuppress3
Property.Description: Controls which level 3 (INFO) debug logs are not saved to the log file. Each byte is a SIN.

Property.Name: uploadDebugLogFormat
Property.Description: Controls which format is used for sending debug log upload messages.

Message.Name: setDataLogFilter
Message.Description: Sets a filter for subsequent retrieval of data log records.

Field.Name: seqStart
Field.Description: The start of the range of sequence numbers to include.

Field.Name: seqEnd
Field.Description: The end of the range of sequence numbers to include.

Field.Name: timeStart
Field.Description: The start of the range of timestamps to include.

Field.Name: timeEnd
Field.Description: The end of the range of timestamps to include.

Field.Name: reverse
Field.Description: Whether to return the records in reverse order.

Field.Name: list
Field.Description: An optional list of SIN/MIN pairs to include. If not specified, or the size is 0, include all SINs.

Field.Name: sin
Field.Description: SIN to include.

Field.Name: minList
Field.Description: A list of MINs to include for the SIN. If not specified, or the size is 0, include all MINs.

Message.Name: setDebugLogFilter
Message.Description: Sets a filter for subsequent retrieval of debug log records.

Field.Name: seqStart
Field.Description: The start of the range of sequence numbers to include.

Field.Name: seqEnd
Field.Description: The end of the range of sequence numbers to include.

Field.Name: timeStart
Field.Description: The start of the range of timestamps to include.

Field.Name: timeEnd
Field.Description: The end of the range of timestamps to include.

Field.Name: reverse
Field.Description: Whether to return the records in reverse order.

Field.Name: levels
Field.Description: An optional bitmap of debug levels to include.

Message.Name: getDataLogCount
Message.Description: Requests the remaining number of data log records that match the current filter.

Message.Name: getDebugLogCount
Message.Description: Requests the remaining number of debug log records that match the current filter.

Message.Name: getDataLogEntries
Message.Description: Requests a block of data log records that match the current filter.

Field.Name: maxSize
Field.Description: The maximum size of the return message. At least 1 record will be returned, even if it causes the return message to exceed this value. If not specified, the maximum size of messages supported by the terminal is used.

Field.Name: maxEntries
Field.Description: The maximum number of records to return. If not specified, return as many records as will fit in the maximum size.

Message.Name: getDebugLogEntries
Message.Description: Requests a block of debug log records that match the current filter.

Field.Name: maxSize
Field.Description: The maximum size of the return message. At least 1 record will be returned, even if it causes the return message to exceed this value. If not specified, the maximum size of messages supported by the terminal is used.

Field.Name: maxEntries
Field.Description: The maximum number of records to return. If not specified, return as many records as will fit in the maximum size.

Message.Name: clearLogs
Message.Description: Removes all log files associated with the given log type.

Field.Name: logType
Field.Description: Which set of log files to remove.

Message.Name: setUploadDataLogFilter
Message.Description: Sets a filter for subsequent retrieval of data log records.

Field.Name: maxSize
Field.Description: The maximum size of individual uploadDataLogEntries return messages. At least 1 record will be returned, even if it causes the return message to exceed this value. If not specified, the maximum size of messages supported by the terminal is used.

Field.Name: maxEntries
Field.Description: The maximum number of records to return in individual uploadDataLogEntries return messages. If not specified, return as many records as will fit in the maximum size.

Field.Name: ageLimit
Field.Description: Age limit (with respect to ever-changing system time), in seconds, that can be used to restrict (by age) the number of records to be auto uploaded. Only records within the age limit are auto uploaded. Any age limit < 60 will be set to 60. If not specified, include all records.

Field.Name: reverse
Field.Description: Whether to return the records in reverse order.

Field.Name: list
Field.Description: An optional list of SIN/MIN pairs to include. If not specified, or the size is 0, include all SINs.

Field.Name: sin
Field.Description: SIN to include.

Field.Name: minList
Field.Description: A list of MINs to include for the SIN. If not specified, or the size is 0, include all MINs.

Message.Name: setUploadDebugLogFilter
Message.Description: Sets a filter for subsequent retrieval of debug log records.

Field.Name: maxSize
Field.Description: The maximum size of individual uploadDataLogEntries return messages. At least 1 record will be returned, even if it causes the return message to exceed this value. If not specified, the maximum size of messages supported by the terminal is used.

Field.Name: maxEntries
Field.Description: The maximum number of records to return in individual uploadDataLogEntries return messages. If not specified, return as many records as will fit in the maximum size.

Field.Name: ageLimit
Field.Description: Age limit (with respect to ever-changing system time), in seconds, that can be used to restrict (by age) the number of records to be auto uploaded. Only records within the age limit are auto uploaded. Any age limit < 60 will be set to 60. If not specified, include all records.

Field.Name: reverse
Field.Description: Whether to return the records in reverse order.

Field.Name: levels
Field.Description: An optional bitmap of debug levels to include.

Message.Name: getUploadDataLogCount
Message.Description: Requests the remaining number of data log records that match the current filter.

Message.Name: getUploadDebugLogCount
Message.Description: Requests the remaining number of debug log records that match the current filter.

Message.Name: setDebugLogFilter2
Message.Description: Sets a filter for subsequent retrieval of debug log records. This message must be used instead of setDebugLogFilter when the SIN is to be used as a filtering criterion.

Field.Name: seqStart
Field.Description: The start of the range of sequence numbers to include.

Field.Name: seqEnd
Field.Description: The end of the range of sequence numbers to include.

Field.Name: timeStart
Field.Description: The start of the range of timestamps to include.

Field.Name: timeEnd
Field.Description: The end of the range of timestamps to include.

Field.Name: reverse
Field.Description: Whether to return the records in reverse order.

Field.Name: levels
Field.Description: An optional bitmap of debug levels to include.

Field.Name: list
Field.Description: An optional list of SINs to include. If not specified, or the size is 0, include all SINs.

Message.Name: getDebugLogEntries2
Message.Description: Requests a block of records matching the data log filter. This message must be used instead of getDebugLogEntries when the response must include the SIN.

Field.Name: maxSize
Field.Description: The maximum size of the return message. At least 1 record will be returned, even if it causes the return message to exceed this value. If not specified, the maximum size of messages supported by the terminal is used.

Field.Name: maxEntries
Field.Description: The maximum number of records to return. If not specified, return as many records as will fit in the maximum size.

Message.Name: setUploadDebugLogFilter2
Message.Description: Sets a filter for the auto uploading of data log records. This message must be used instead of setUploadDebugLogFilter when the SIN is to be used as a filtering criterion.

Field.Name: maxSize
Field.Description: The maximum size of individual uploadDataLogEntries return messages. At least 1 record will be returned, even if it causes the return message to exceed this value. If not specified, the maximum size of messages supported by the terminal is used.

Field.Name: maxEntries

Field.Description: An optional list of SINs to include. If not specified, or the size is 0, include all SINs.

Property.Name: rs232mainEnabled
Property.Description: Enable use of the main RS232 port (no longer used).

Property.Name: rs232mainBaudRate
Property.Description: Main RS232 baud rate.

Property.Name: rs232mainDataBits
Property.Description: Main RS232 number of data bits.

Property.Name: rs232mainParity
Property.Description: Main RS232 parity mode.

Property.Name: rs232mainStopBits
Property.Description: Main RS232 number of stop bits.

Property.Name: rs232mainTcvrMode
Property.Description: Main RS232 Tranceiver mode.

Property.Name: rs232mainDTEIsConnected
Property.Description: Indicates whether DTE is connected on the main RS232.

Property.Name: rs232mainDTEAlarm
Property.Description: Control generation of DTE alarm message for the main RS232.

Property.Name: rs232mainDTELog
Property.Description: Control generation of DTE alarm log for the main RS232.

Property.Name: rs232mainDTEEdgeDetect
Property.Description: Controls event generation for DTE connection state changes on the main RS232.

Property.Name: rs232mainDTEEdgeSampleCount
Property.Description: Number of 1ms samples needed before declaring a connection state change on the main RS232.

Property.Name: rs232mainDTEEdgeSampleError
Property.Description: Acceptable percentage of error samples on the main RS232.

Property.Name: rs232mainBreakAlarm
Property.Description: Control if a message is generated when a BREAK condition is detected on the main RS232.

Property.Name: rs232mainBreakLog
Property.Description: Controls if a log is generated when a BREAK condition is detected on the main RS232.

Property.Name: rs232mainShutdownMode
Property.Description: Define when the main RS232 can be shutdown to save power.

Message.Name: readPort
Message.Description: Requests a current port value. A portValue message is generated in response.

Field.Name: port
Field.Description: The port number.

Message.Name: writePort
Message.Description: Writes a new output value to an appropriately configured port.

Field.Name: port
Field.Description: The port number.

Field.Name: value
Field.Description: The new output value.

Message.Name: pulsePort
Message.Description: Temporarily changes the state of an output port.

Field.Name: port
Field.Description: The port number.

Field.Name: duration
Field.Description: The number of milliseconds to keep the output port inverted, before changing it back to its original state.

Message.Name: portValue
Message.Description: The current value of a port.

Field.Name: port
Field.Description: The port number.

Field.Name: value
Field.Description: The current port value.

Message.Name: portAlarm
Message.Description: An alarm for a port state change.

Field.Name: port
Field.Description: The port number.

Field.Name: value
Field.Description: The current port value.

Field.Name: type
Field.Description: The alarm type, for analog alarms only

Property.Name: source
Property.Description: The source of position data.

Property.Name: fixValid
Property.Description: Whether the last fix attempt succeeded or timed out. If set to false, the rest of the properties are from the previous valid fix taken.

Property.Name: fixType
Property.Description: The type of the last fix.

Property.Name: reserved1
Property.Description: This property is reserved for future use.

Property.Name: reserved2
Property.Description: This property is reserved for future use.

Property.Name: latitude
Property.Description: Latitude in milliminutes.

Property.Name: longitude
Property.Description: Longitude in milliminutes.

Property.Name: altitude
Property.Description: Altitude in tenths of meters.

Property.Name: speed
Property.Description: Speed in tenths of knots.

Property.Name: heading
Property.Description: Heading in tenths of degrees.

Property.Name: fixTime
Property.Description: The time the last position was obtained, expressed as the number of seconds since the epoch.

Property.Name: fixAge
Property.Description: The age of the fix in seconds.

Property.Name: fixMode
Property.Description: The mode that was used to obtain the fix.

Property.Name: mode
Property.Description: The mode to use to obtain the next fix, or in continuous mode.

Property.Name: continuous
Property.Description: The update frequency, in seconds, for the position information. Enabling this allows the service to respond immediately to fix requests, at the expense of increased power consumption. Setting it to 0 disables automatic updating. Only valid on supported GPS sources.

Property.Name: jammingInd
Property.Description: GPS jamming indicator. Only valid on supported GPS sources.

Property.Name: jammingFlag
Property.Description: GPS jamming detection flag, Only valid on supported GPS sources.

Property.Name: jammingRaw
Property.Description: The raw GPS jamming value. Only valid on supported GPS sources.

Property.Name: acquireTimeout
Property.Description: The maximum amount of time, in seconds, to wait to acquire a GPS signal (0 is disabled).

Property.Name: maxFixTimeout
Property.Description: The maximum amount of time, in seconds, that the GPS provider waits before giving up on getting a fix.

Property.Name: metricSpeed
Property.Description: Speed in tenths of kilometers per hour.

Property.Name: hdop
Property.Description: Horizontal Dilution Of Precision * 10.

Property.Name: numSats
Property.Description: Number of satellites in view at the time of the last fix.

Message.Name: getPosition
Message.Description: Requests a fix. A position message is generated in response.

Field.Name: fixType
Field.Description: The desired fix type.

Field.Name: timeout
Field.Description: The maximum amount of time, in seconds, to wait for the fix before giving up. This is capped at 180 seconds

Field.Name: age
Field.Description: The maximum acceptable age of the fix, in seconds. If the last fix is older than this value, a new one will be requested.

Message.Name: getLastPosition
Message.Description: Retrieves the last known fix. A position message is generated in response.

Message.Name: getSources
Message.Description: Retrieves a list of sources supported by this terminal. A sources message is generated in response.

Message.Name: position
Message.Description: Contains position information.

Field.Name: fixValid
Field.Description: Whether the fix data is valid. If true, the fix position data is current; otherwise the data is from a previous fix.

Field.Name: fixType
Field.Description: The fix type.

Field.Name: latitude
Field.Description: The latitude in milliminutes.

Field.Name: longitude
Field.Description: The longitude in milliminutes.

Field.Name: altitude
Field.Description: The altitude in tenths of meters.

Field.Name: speed
Field.Description: The speed in tenths of knots.

Field.Name: heading
Field.Description: The heading in tenths of degrees.

Field.Name: timestamp
Field.Description: The time the last position was obtained, expressed as the number of seconds sinec the epoch.

Message.Name: sources
Message.Description: Contains a list of sources supported on this terminal.

Field.Name: mask
Field.Description: A bitmap of supported sources.

Property.Name: report4Interval
Property.Description: The time interval, in minutes, between two consecutive periodic reports.

Property.Name: report4Send
Property.Description: Controls whether this periodic report is sent as a message.

Property.Name: report4Log
Property.Description: Controls whether this periodic report is logged.

Property.Name: logRequests
Property.Description: Controls whether log reports that are manually requested should be logged.

Property.Name: reserved1
Property.Description: This property is reserved for future use.

Property.Name: reserved2
Property.Description: This property is reserved for future use.

Property.Name: reserved3
Property.Description: This property is reserved for future use.

Property.Name: reserved4
Property.Description: This property is reserved for future use.

Property.Name: reserved5
Property.Description: This property is reserved for future use.

Property.Name: reserved6
Property.Description: This property is reserved for future use.

Property.Name: reserved7
Property.Description: This property is reserved for future use.

Property.Name: reserved8
Property.Description: This property is reserved for future use.

Property.Name: reserved9
Property.Description: This property is reserved for future use.

Property.Name: maxAge1
Property.Description: The maximum age value (in seconds) to use if a GPS fix request is required to send report 1. Setting this to 0 automatically uses half the interval value.

Property.Name: timeout1
Property.Description: The timeout value (in seconds) to use if a GPS fix request is required to send report 1. If this value is greater than the interval, then the interval is used instead.

Property.Name: maxAge2
Property.Description: The maximum age value (in seconds) to use if a GPS fix request is required to send report 2. Setting this to 0 automatically uses half the interval value.

Property.Name: timeout2
Property.Description: The timeout value (in seconds) to use if a GPS fix request is required to send report 2. If this value is greater than the interval, then the interval is used instead.

Property.Name: maxAge3
Property.Description: The maximum age value (in seconds) to use if a GPS fix request is required to send report 3. Setting this to 0 automatically uses half the interval value.

Property.Name: timeout3
Property.Description: The timeout value (in seconds) to use if a GPS fix request is required to send report 3. If this value is greater than the interval, then the interval is used instead.

Property.Name: maxAge4
Property.Description: The maximum age value (in seconds) to use if a GPS fix request is required to send report 4. Setting this to 0 automatically uses half the interval value.

Property.Name: timeout4
Property.Description: The timeout value (in seconds) to use if a GPS fix request is required to send report 4. If this value is greater than the interval, then the interval is used instead.

Message.Name: generateReport
Message.Description: Request for a report to be sent out. The corresponding return message is generated in response.

Field.Name: reportSIN
Field.Description: The SIN of the report to send (16-255)

Field.Name: reportMIN
Field.Description: The MIN of the report to send (1-255).

Field.Name: reserved
Field.Description: This field is reserved for future use.

Field.Name: priority
Field.Description: An optional priority for the message. If not specified, uses the priority property of the message service.

Field.Name: retry
Field.Description: An optional retry flag for the message. If not specified, uses the retry property of the message service.

Field.Name: lifetime
Field.Description: An optional lifetime for the message. If not specified, uses the lifetime property of the message service.

Field.Name: send
Field.Description: An optional send flag for the message. If not specified, uses the retry property of the message service.

Field.Name: log
Field.Description: An optional log flag for the message. If not specified, uses the retry property of the message service.

Field.Name: maxAge
Field.Description: The maximum age value (in seconds) to use if a GPS fix request is required to send the report. If omitted, or set to 0, 60 seconds is used.

Field.Name: timeout
Field.Description: The timeout value (in seconds) to use if a GPS fix request is required to send the report. If omitted, or set to 0, 180 seconds is used.

Message.Name: simpleReport
Message.Description: A basic report which contains only position information.

Message.Name: fullReport
Message.Description: A longer report which contains position information, EIO port configurations and values, and the current connection status of the DTE.

Message.Name: EIO
Message.Description: Report analog/digital I/Os

Message.Name: noEIO
Message.Description: Same as fullReport, but without EIO values.

Message.Name: fullReport2
Message.Description: A longer report which contains position information and EEIO port values.

Message.Name: write
Message.Description: Write data to a file.

Field.Name: path
Field.Description: Path name of the file.

Field.Name: offset
Field.Description: Offset to write the data. Use -1 to append to the file.

Field.Name: flags
Field.Description: Describes how to carry out the operation.

Field.Name: data
Field.Description: File content to write.

Message.Name: read
Message.Description: Read data from a file.

Field.Name: path
Field.Description: Path name of the file.

Field.Name: offset
Field.Description: Offset to read the data from; negative number means from the end of the file.

Field.Name: size
Field.Description: The number of bytes to read (up to 6100).

Message.Name: dir
Message.Description: Get the contents of a directory.

Field.Name: path
Field.Description: The directory path.

Message.Name: stat
Message.Description: Get information about a given file or directory.

Field.Name: path
Field.Description: The file path.

Message.Name: writeResult
Message.Description: Result sent from a write command.

Field.Name: path
Field.Description: Path name of the file.

Field.Name: offset
Field.Description: Offset specified by the write operation. Returns the actual offset if -1 was specified.

Field.Name: flags
Field.Description: Describes how the operation was carried out.

Field.Name: result
Field.Description: Result of the operation.

Message.Name: readResult
Message.Description: Result sent from a read command.

Field.Name: path
Field.Description: Path name of the file.

Field.Name: offset
Field.Description: Offset specified by the read operation. Returns the actual offset if negative number was specified.

Field.Name: result
Field.Description: Result of the operation.

Field.Name: EOF
Field.Description: Set to true if the end of the file has been reached.

Field.Name: data
Field.Description: File content.

Message.Name: dirResult
Message.Description: The content of the given directory.

Field.Name: path
Field.Description: The requested path.

Field.Name: entries
Field.Description: The directory entries.

Field.Name: type
Field.Description: The entry type.

Field.Name: name
Field.Description: The file or directory name.

Field.Name: size
Field.Description: The file size (or 0 for directories).

Field.Name: creationTime
Field.Description: The creation time of the file or directory, expressed as the number of seconds since the epoch.

Message.Name: statResult
Message.Description: Information about the given file or directory.

Field.Name: path
Field.Description: The requested path.

Field.Name: attributes
Field.Description: A bitmap of the file attributes.

Field.Name: size
Field.Description: The file size (or 0 for diretories).

Field.Name: creationTime
Field.Description: The file or directory creation time, expressed as the number of seconds since the epoch.

Field.Name: MD5Hash
Field.Description: The MD5 hash of the file contents.

Property.Name: attach
Property.Description: If true, attaches the shell to the rs232 port

Property.Name: tracebackOnError
Property.Description: Generate a traceback when an error occurs

Property.Name: executionTimeout
Property.Description: The maximum time in seconds that a non-interactive shell command can execute for. Use zero for no limit.

Property.Name: accessLevel
Property.Description: Current access level of the shell

Message.Name: executeCmd
Message.Description: Requests a CLI command to be executed in the shell.

Field.Name: tag
Field.Description: A numeric tag that is reflected in the response message.

Field.Name: data
Field.Description: The command to execute.

Message.Name: executeLua
Message.Description: Execute a Lua string on the terminal.

Field.Name: tag
Field.Description: A numeric tag that is reflected in the response message.

Field.Name: data
Field.Description: The Lua command to execute

Message.Name: executePrivilegedCmd
Message.Description: Requests a privileged CLI command to be executed in the shell

Field.Name: tag
Field.Description: A numeric tag that is reflected in the response message.

Field.Name: level
Field.Description: Access level of the password

Field.Name: password
Field.Description: Password for the specified access level

Field.Name: data
Field.Description: The command to execute.

Message.Name: executePrivilegedLua
Message.Description: Execute a Lua string on the terminal using privilged access.

Field.Name: tag
Field.Description: A numeric tag that is reflected in the response message.

Field.Name: level
Field.Description: Access level of the password

Field.Name: password
Field.Description: Password for the specified access level

Field.Name: data
Field.Description: The Lua command to execute

Message.Name: getAccessInfo
Message.Description: Retrieve the access levels

Message.Name: setAccessLevel
Message.Description: Set the OTA access level of the shell

Field.Name: level
Field.Description: Access level to set

Field.Name: password
Field.Description: Password for the specified access level

Message.Name: changeAccessPassword
Message.Description: Set the password for the specified access level

Field.Name: level
Field.Description: Access level of the password to change

Field.Name: old
Field.Description: The current access level password value.

Field.Name: new
Field.Description: The new access level password value. Empty string to remove the password.

Message.Name: cmdResult
Message.Description: The output of an executed command.

Field.Name: tag
Field.Description: The numeric tag from the execute command message.

Field.Name: success
Field.Description: Whether the command was successfully executed.

Field.Name: output
Field.Description: The output of the executed command.

Message.Name: accessInfo
Message.Description: Shell access level information

Field.Name: level
Field.Description: Access level for local access to the shell

Field.Name: OTALevel
Field.Description: Access level for shell/Lua over-the-air commands

Message.Name: accessSetChangeResult
Message.Description: The result from setting or changing the access level/password.

Field.Name: success
Field.Description: Whether the operation succeeded or not.

Field.Name: error
Field.Description: A description of the error, if success is false.

Property.Name: enabled
Property.Description: Controls whether the geofence functionality is enabled or not.

Property.Name: interval
Property.Description: The time interval, in seconds, between two consecutive geofence checks.

Property.Name: hysteresis
Property.Description: The time hysteresis for fence crossings, in seconds. The fence status is rechecked once after this time has elapsed before officially declaring a fence crossing. The value must be smaller than or equal to the interval.

Property.Name: sendAlarm
Property.Description: Controls whether alarm messages should be sent over the air.

Property.Name: logAlarm
Property.Description: Controls whether alarm messages should be logged.

Property.Name: fileName
Property.Description: The path and name of the geofence database file. This path is relative to the geofence service's data directory.

Property.Name: reserved1
Property.Description: This property is reserved for future use.

Property.Name: reserved2
Property.Description: This property is reserved for future use.

Property.Name: reserved3
Property.Description: This property is reserved for future use.

Property.Name: reserved4
Property.Description: This property is reserved for future use.

Property.Name: reserved5
Property.Description: This property is reserved for future use.

Property.Name: reserved6
Property.Description: This property is reserved for future use.

Property.Name: reserved7
Property.Description: This property is reserved for future use.

Property.Name: reserved8
Property.Description: This property is reserved for future use.

Property.Name: reserved9
Property.Description: This property is reserved for future use.

Property.Name: entryHysteresis
Property.Description: The distance hysteresis for fence entry, in meters. A fence crossing is not declared until the position is this many meters inside the fence.

Property.Name: exitHysteresis
Property.Description: The distance hysteresis for fence exit, in meters. A fence crossing is not declared until the position is this many meters outside the fence.

Property.Name: combineMessages
Property.Description: This controls whether the alarm or alarms message is used for sending/logging fence crossings. If the former is used, simultaneous fence crossings result in multiple messages sent.

Property.Name: combineEvents
Property.Description: This controls whether the ALARM or ALARMS event is generated on fence crossings. If the former is used, simultaneous fence crossings result in multiple events sent.

Property.Name: maxAge
Property.Description: The maximum age value (in seconds) to use when requesting the GPS fix. Setting this to 0 automatically uses half the interval value.

Property.Name: timeout
Property.Description: The timeout value (in seconds) to use when requesting the GPS fix. If this value is greater than the interval, then the interval is used instead.

Property.Name: cacheFences
Property.Description: Controls if fences are cached in memory to improve fence checking time.

Property.Name: checkDoneEvents
Property.Description: Controls the posting of fence and hysteresis checing done events.

Message.Name: setCircle
Message.Description: Configures a circle fence. If the fence number already exists, this overwrites it.

Field.Name: number
Field.Description: The fence number to configure.

Field.Name: enabled
Field.Description: Whether this fence is enabled or not.

Field.Name: alarmCondition
Field.Description: Controls when alarms should be generated.

Field.Name: centreLatitude
Field.Description: The latitude of the centre point, in milliminutes.

Field.Name: centreLongitude
Field.Description: The longitude of the centre point, in milliminutes.

Field.Name: radius
Field.Description: The radius of the fence, in meters.

Message.Name: setPolygon
Message.Description: Configures a polygon fence. If the fence number already exists, this overwrites it.

Field.Name: number
Field.Description: The fence number to configure.

Field.Name: enabled
Field.Description: Whether this fence is enabled or not.

Field.Name: alarmCondition
Field.Description: Controls when alarms should be generated.

Field.Name: points
Field.Description: A list of the polygon's points.

Field.Name: latitude
Field.Description: The latitude of the point, in milliminutes.

Field.Name: longitude
Field.Description: The longitude of the point, in milliminutes.

Message.Name: enableFence
Message.Description: Enables or disables an individual fence.

Field.Name: number
Field.Description: The fence number to enable or disable.

Field.Name: enable
Field.Description: Whether this fence should be enabled or not.

Message.Name: updateAlarmCond
Message.Description: Updates the alarmCondition property of a fence.

Field.Name: number
Field.Description: The fence number to update.

Field.Name: alarmCondition
Field.Description: Controls when alarms should be generated.

Message.Name: getStatus
Message.Description: Retrieves the current status of a single fence. A fenceStatus message is generated in response.

Field.Name: number
Field.Description: The fence number to retrieve.

Message.Name: getAllStatus
Message.Description: Retrieves the current status of all fences. An allFencesStatus message is generated in response.

Message.Name: setRectangle
Message.Description: Configures a rectangle fence. If the fence number already exists, this overwrites it.

Field.Name: number
Field.Description: The fence number to configure.

Field.Name: enabled
Field.Description: Whether this fence is enabled or not.

Field.Name: alarmCondition
Field.Description: Controls when alarms should be generated.

Field.Name: centreLatitude
Field.Description: The latitude of the centre point, in milliminutes.

Field.Name: centreLongitude
Field.Description: The longitude of the centre point, in milliminutes.

Field.Name: latitudeDistance
Field.Description: Distance that the rectangle extends to the north and south from the center, in meters.

Field.Name: longitudeDistance
Field.Description: Distance that the rectangle extends to the east and west from the center, in meters.

Message.Name: alarm
Message.Description: A fence crossing alarm.

Field.Name: number
Field.Description: The fence number to which the alarm applies.

Field.Name: status
Field.Description: Whether the alarm is for a fence entry or exit.

Field.Name: latitude
Field.Description: The latitude at the time the alarm was declared, in milliminutes.

Field.Name: longitude
Field.Description: The longitude at the time the alarm was declared, in milliminutes.

Message.Name: fenceStatus
Message.Description: The status of a single fence.

Field.Name: number
Field.Description: The fence number.

Field.Name: defined
Field.Description: Whether this fence is currently configured.

Field.Name: enabled
Field.Description: Whether this fence is currently enabled.

Field.Name: status
Field.Description: Whether position was inside or outside the fence at the last check time.

Message.Name: allFencesStatus
Message.Description: The status of all fences.

Field.Name: defined
Field.Description: Each bit indicated whether a given fence is currently configured.

Field.Name: enabled
Field.Description: Each bit indicates whether a given fence is currently enabled.

Field.Name: inside
Field.Description: Each bit indicates whether the position was inside the fence at the last check time.

Field.Name: outside
Field.Description: Each bit indicates whether the position was outside the fence at the last check time.

Message.Name: alarms
Message.Description: One or more simultaneous fence crossing alarms.

Field.Name: list
Field.Description: The array of fence crossing data.

Field.Name: number
Field.Description: The fence number to which the alarm applies.

Field.Name: status
Field.Description: Whether the alarm is for a fence entry or exit.

Field.Name: latitude
Field.Description: The latitude at the time the alarm was declared, in milliminutes.

Field.Name: longitude
Field.Description: The longitude at the time the alarm was declared, in milliminutes.

Property.Name: sim1PIN
Property.Description: The Personal Identification Number (PIN) to authenticate the first SIM. Must be a 4 to 8 character alphanumeric value. This property is ignored if no PIN is required.

Property.Name: sim1APN
Property.Description: The Access Point Name (APN) used to connect to an IP network using the first SIM.

Property.Name: sim1Username
Property.Description: The username required to connect to an IP network using the first SIM (if any).

Property.Name: sim1Password
Property.Description: The password required to connect to an IP network using the first SIM (if any).

Property.Name: sim1DNS1
Property.Description: The first DNS address used on the first SIM. Leaving this string empty uses the dynamically assigned IP address, if any.

Property.Name: sim1DNS2
Property.Description: The second DNS address used on the first SIM. Leaving this string empty uses the dynamically assigned IP address, if any.

Property.Name: sim2PIN
Property.Description: The Personal Identification Number (PIN) to authenticate the second SIM. Must be a 4 to 8 character alphanumeric value. This property is ignored if no PIN is required.

Property.Name: sim2APN
Property.Description: The Access Point Name (APN) used to connect to an IP network using the second SIM.

Property.Name: sim2Username
Property.Description: The username required to connect to an IP network using the second SIM (if any).

Property.Name: sim2Password
Property.Description: The password required to connect to an IP network using the second SIM (if any).

Property.Name: sim2DNS1
Property.Description: The first DNS address used on the second SIM. Leaving this string empty uses the dynamically assigned IP address, if any.

Property.Name: sim2DNS2
Property.Description: The second DNS address used on the second SIM. Leaving this string empty uses the dynamically assigned IP address, if any.

Property.Name: activeSim
Property.Description: Indicates and controls which SIM is currently active.

Property.Name: sim1AuthMode
Property.Description: The authentication mode to use when connecting to an IP network using the first SIM .

Property.Name: sim2AuthMode
Property.Description: The authentication mode to use when connecting to an IP network using the second SIM .

Property.Name: APNConnected
Property.Description: Whether we're currently connected to the APN.

Property.Name: manufacturer
Property.Description: The GPRS module's manufacturer name.

Property.Name: model
Property.Description: The GPRS module's model name.

Property.Name: revision
Property.Description: The GPRS module's software revision.

Property.Name: imei
Property.Description: The International Mobile Equipment Identity (IMEI) of the GPRS module.

Property.Name: imsi
Property.Description: The International Mobile Subscriber Identity (IMSI) of the current SIM.

Property.Name: iccid
Property.Description: The Integrated Circuit Card Identifier (ICCID) of the current SIM.

Property.Name: cellID
Property.Description: The ID of the cell the current SIM is registered on.

Property.Name: lac
Property.Description: The Location Area Code (LAC) of the cell the current SIM is registered on.

Property.Name: mcc
Property.Description: The Mobile Country Code (MCC) of the cell the current SIM is registered on.

Property.Name: mnc
Property.Description: The Mobile Network Code (MNC) of the cell thee current SIM is registered on.

Property.Name: networkAllowed
Property.Description: Whether the current network is allowed or disallowed.

Property.Name: whichList
Property.Description: Which list caused the network to be allowed or disallowed.

Property.Name: linkStability
Property.Description: Gives an indication of link stability, including interference and jamming.

Property.Name: numChannelCurrent
Property.Description: The number of channels used in jamming detection.

Property.Name: ssMeanCurrent
Property.Description: The mean signal strength value across all channels (0 when linkStability is Normal)

Property.Name: ssVarCurrent
Property.Description: The signal strength variance across all channels (-1 when linkStability is Normal)

Property.Name: numChannelThreshold
Property.Description: The threshold for the number of channels, below which jamming is ruled out.

Property.Name: ssMeanThreshold
Property.Description: The threshold for the mean signal strength value (dBm) across all channels above which interference or jamming is declared.

Property.Name: ssVarThreshold
Property.Description: The threshold for the signal strength variance across all channels below which jamming is declared; if above this threshold, interference is declared.

Property.Name: rssi
Property.Description: The Received Signal Strenght Indicator, as exposed by the AT+CSQ command defined by 3GPP TS 27.007.

Property.Name: powerOn
Property.Description: Controls whether the module should be powered up on startup and after the SIM slot cover is closed.

Property.Name: powerOnStatus
Property.Description: Indicates whether power to the GPRS modem is currently on.

Property.Name: coverOpen
Property.Description: Indicates whether the SIM slot cover is currently open.

Property.Name: simStatus
Property.Description: The current status of the SIM card.

Property.Name: networkStatus
Property.Description: The current network status.

Property.Name: serverConnected
Property.Description: Indicates whether a connection to the server was succesfully established

Property.Name: failImmediately
Property.Description: Controls whether a from-terminal message fails immediately when the module is powered off or suitable network is not available.

Property.Name: server1
Property.Description: The name, or IP address, of a server to connect to for sending/retrieving messages.

Property.Name: port1
Property.Description: The port number on server1 to connect to for sending/retrieving messages.

Property.Name: server2
Property.Description: The name, or IP address, of a server to connect to for sending/retrieving messages.

Property.Name: port2
Property.Description: The port number on server2 to connect to for sending/retrieving messages.

Property.Name: pollingInterval
Property.Description: How frequently, in minutes, the terminal should check with the server for new forward messages (0 disabled polling).

Property.Name: pollOnTransmit
Property.Description: Whether a terminal should check for new forward messages after a return message is transmitted.

Property.Name: targetMode
Property.Description: This property controls whether the module operates on 2G and/or 3G. Only valid for 3G modules.

Property.Name: currentMode
Property.Description: This property shows which mode the module is currently operating in. Only valid for 3G modules.

Property.Name: tcpRetryTimeout
Property.Description: The initial retry timeout (in seconds) for TCP packets.

Property.Name: dbgLevel
Property.Description: The level of debugging informatino output by the service.

Property.Name: sim1Present
Property.Description: Whether a SIM card is detected in slot 1.

Property.Name: sim2Present
Property.Description: Whether a SIM card is detected in slot 2.

Property.Name: msgProtocol
Property.Description: Controls which protocol is used to transfer messages to the remote server.

Property.Name: ipTransport
Property.Description: Controls which IP transport is used for IDPoIP.

Property.Name: mode
Property.Description: Controls whether a session is established permanently or on-demand when using IDPoIP.

Property.Name: tcpKeepAlive
Property.Description: Controls the rate (in seconds)at which keep-alive messages are sent over TCP when a session is idle.

Property.Name: udpKeepAlive
Property.Description: Controls the rate (in seconds)at which extra acknowledgement frames are sent over UDP when a session is idle.

Property.Name: udpSessionLifetime
Property.Description: Controls how long (in seconds) a UDP session can stay idle before the terminal requests an acknowledgement from the server. If this value is smaller than the udpKeepAlive one, then keep alive messages are never sent.

Property.Name: tcpRetries
Property.Description: Controls the number of consecutive attempts made at establishing a TCP connection before giving up for a lengthy time.

Property.Name: udpRetries
Property.Description: Controls the number of times unacknowledged messages are sent.

Field.Name: sim1BlackList

Field.Name: mnc
Field.Description: The Mobile Network Code of the entry.

Field.Name: sim2WhiteList
Field.Description: An array of white list entries for SIM2.

Field.Name: mcc
Field.Description: The Mobile Country Code of the entry.

Field.Name: mnc
Field.Description: The Mobile Network Code of the entry.

Field.Name: sim2BlackList
Field.Description: An array of black list entries for SIM2.

Field.Name: mcc
Field.Description: The Mobile Country Code of the entry.

Field.Name: mnc
Field.Description: The Mobile Network Code of the entry.

Property.Name: input1Config
Property.Description: input1 configuration.

Property.Name: input1EdgeDetect
Property.Description: Controls the edge detection type when input1 is configured as a digital input.

Property.Name: input1EdgeFilterCount
Property.Description: Number of additional consecutive 100ms samples needed to declare an edge transition for input1.

Property.Name: input1AnalogSampleRate
Property.Description: Sample period, in seconds, when input1 is configured as an analog input.

Property.Name: input1AnalogFilterCount
Property.Description: Number of consecutive samples needed to declare an analog threshold change.

Property.Name: input1AnalogLowThreshold
Property.Description: The low threshold in mV for the analog input.

Property.Name: input1AnalogHighThreshold
Property.Description: The high threshold in mV for the analog input.

Property.Name: input1AlarmMsg
Property.Description: Controls whether alarm messages should be generated for input1.

Property.Name: input1AlarmLog
Property.Description: Controls whether alarm logs should be generated for input1.

Property.Name: input1Value
Property.Description: The current input1 value.

Property.Name: input2Config
Property.Description: input2 configuration.

Property.Name: input2EdgeDetect
Property.Description: Controls the edge detection type when input2 is configured as a digital input.

Property.Name: input2EdgeFilterCount
Property.Description: Number of additional consecutive 100ms samples needed to declare an edge transition for input2.

Property.Name: input2AnalogSampleRate
Property.Description: Sample period, in seconds, when input2 is configured as an analog input.

Property.Name: input2AnalogFilterCount
Property.Description: Number of consecutive samples needed to declare an analog threshold change.

Property.Name: input2AnalogLowThreshold
Property.Description: The low threshold in mV for the analog input.

Property.Name: input2AnalogHighThreshold
Property.Description: The high threshold in mV for the analog input.

Property.Name: input2AlarmMsg
Property.Description: Controls whether alarm messages should be generated for input2.

Property.Name: input2AlarmLog
Property.Description: Controls whether alarm logs should be generated for input2.

Property.Name: input2Value
Property.Description: The current input2 value.

Property.Name: input3Config
Property.Description: input3 configuration.

Property.Name: input3EdgeDetect
Property.Description: Controls the edge detection type when input3 is configured as a digital input.

Property.Name: input3EdgeFilterCount
